examination.instruction: Choose one correct option from the following options
examination.subject: Chemical Pathology

options.option: Triglycerides T
Two fatty acids T
Phosphoric acid linked to nitrogenous base T
Cholesterol linked to nitrogenous base F
none of these F
are classified according to chain length T
are not bound to protein in plasma F
are the most metabolically active lipid fraction T
are influenced by the amount of glucose available for oxidation T
is a steroid F
has hormonal activity F
is found exclusively in animals and humans T
is synthesized totally in the liver T
is present in blood mainly as esters with long chain fatty acids T
bonds covalently with glycine and taurine from bile salts T
is absorbed in the terminal ileum T
present in intestine is in the esterified form F
an intestine is hydrolyzed by pancreatic esteeases
is a precursor of steroid hormones T
are mostly synthesized in the liver T
act as transpotting agent for free fatty acids F c, require apolipoproteins A-1 for its metabolism F
are rich in triglycerides T
show the fastest movement in the electrophoresis F
when internalized is degraded to free cholesterol T
is formed by hepatic delipidation of VLDL T
requires apoliprotein A-II as a recognition protein for binding to specific receptors F
increase is demonstrated by an intense pre-beta band at electrophoresis F
could be elevated in blood due to absent or deficient receptor T
type 1 is associated with increased chylomicrons
type 2 is associated with increased HDL
type 3 is associated with increased LDL
type 4 is associated with increased VLDL
type 5 is associated with increased VLDL and chylomicrons

question.text: The following findings are associated with Fredericksons Type 1 hyperlipoproteinemia

options.option: lipoprotein electrophoresis show intense band at origin
total cholesterol concentration is very high
patients present with itchy yellow nodules on skin
the disorder is common and found in the elderly
the major cause of this disorder is due to deficiency of lipoprotein lipase

question.text: Type II hyperlipoproteinemia is associated with the following

options.option: marked increase in LDL cholesterol
chronic renal failure
diabetes
marked increase in VLDL I sub classification IIa
diet low in saturated fat
marked hypercholesterolemia
LDL cholesterol which is predominant
presence of enlarged orange tonsils
corneal opacity and hepatosplenomegaly
almost absent HDL cholesterol

question.text: In galactosemia individuals are unable to metabolise galactose

options.option: due to the deficiency of lactase F
due to deficiency of galactokinas T
due to deficiency of uridyl transferase T
and result in accumulation of glucose-1-phosphate in tissues F
and result in accumulation of galactose-1-phosphate in tissues T

question.text: In galactosaemia the following metabolites accumulate

options.option: dulcitol
NADPH F
Glucose-1-phosphate F
Galactose-1-phosphate T
NADP T

question.text: During the fed state, extracellular glucose is maintained by

options.option: Glycogenesis T
glucose push by insulin to Brain F
glucose push by insulin to muscle T
the conversion of glucose to glucose-6-phosphate catalysed by glucokinase T
the conversion of glucose to triglcerides and stored F
